# 📄 Overview

This document collects and compares transcription outputs from various LLM and HWR models on selected 19th-century Dutch handwritten archives.

---

## 🧩 Test Metadata

**Document ID:** NL-UTHUA-337-7-399-0001  
**Pages tested:** 1 of 210  
**Period:** January – March 1877  
**File path:** `/batch_memories/downloads/NL-UtHUA_337-7_399_0001.jpg`

### 🔹 Model: Transkribus + Open-AI
### 🔹 Version: Dutchess I + Chat GPT 5
**Prompt:** _No prompt needed_ + Underneath you can see the transcription of one of the tools i used, which is as accurate as possible, however it makes logical mistakes, for example it states "Geboekt 9 february 1947" in the second line, in the top left corner - but it is a logicaly wrong - the number itself is unreadabable, but from the other text it is logical to estimate that it is not 1947 but 1877. Try to refine this text with indication and correction of such logical errors. Don't change any structure or symbols besides those which may be indicated as such errors

### 🔹 Model: Open-AI
### 🔹 Version: Chat-GPT 5
**Prompt:** “You are an expert OCR system. Transcribe the attached image of a 19th-century Dutch handwritten document into Dutch text. Preserve original spelling and punctuation exactly, without translating or adding commentary. If any word is illegible, insert a marker like ‘[?]’ for it. Provide only the verbatim transcription.”  
**Result:** 

